{"step_by_step_thinking": "The pulp of the tooth, according to the documents, is a part of the dentin-pulp complex and is made up of living connective tissues and odontoblasts. It contains a central pulp chamber, pulp horns, and radicular canals. The pulp is also known to contain large nerve trunks and blood vessels. Fibroblasts are a type of cell that are found in connective tissues, which the pulp is made of. Therefore, the pulp proper contains large blood vessels, nerve fibers, and fibroblasts.", "answer_choice": "D. All of the above"}
